workspace.confirm-unload: If you leave the page, you will lose your work. To save your work, you must log in using your GitHub account.

errors.undefined-description: Couldn't find a human description for

banned-attributes.align: Don't use the "align" attribute. Instead, use the CSS text-align property
banned-attributes.background: Don't use the "background" attribute. Instead, use the CSS background property
banned-attributes.bgcolor: Don't use the "bgcolor" attribute. Instead, use the CSS background-color property
banned-attributes.frameborder: Don't use the "__attribute__" attribute. Instead, use the CSS border property
banned-attributes.marginwidth: Don't use the "marginwidth" attribute. Instead, use the CSS margin-left and margin-right properties
banned-attributes.marginheight: Don't use the "marginheight" attribute. Instead, use the CSS margin-top and margin-bottom properties
banned-attributes.scrolling: Don't use the "scrolling" attribute. Instead, use the CSS overflow property
banned-attributes.width: Don't use the "width" attribute. Instead, use the CSS width property

html.lower-case-attribute-name: Use lower case for attribute names
html.attribute-quotes:
You need to put the value of the __attribute__ attribute in quotation marks
Try: __attribute__="myvalue"
html.attribute-value:
Every attribute needs a value.
Try: myattribute="myvalue"
html.doctype:
The first line of your HTML should always be:
<!DOCTYPE html>
html.duplicated-id: You can't use the id "__id__" more than once in your HTML
html.img-src: tags need a src attribute, with the URL of the image you want to display. Try:

deprecated-tag.b: You shouldn't use the <b> tag. Use the <strong> tag or the CSS font-weight property instead
deprecated-tag.big: You shouldn't use the <big> tag. Use the CSS font-size property instead
deprecated-tag.center: You shouldn't use the <center> tag. Use the CSS text-align property instead
deprecated-tag.font: You shouldn't use the <font> tag. Use the CSS font-family property instead.
deprecated-tag.i: You shouldn't use the <i> tag. Use the <em> tag or the CSS font-style: italic property instead
deprecated-tag.strike: You shouldn't use the <strike> tag. Use the CSS property text-decoration: line-through instead
deprecated-tag.tt: You shouldn't use the <tt> tag. Use the <code> tag instead.

html.lower-case-tag-name: Use lower case for tag names
html.missing-title: Put a <title> tag inside your <head> tag
html.duplicated-title: You have more than one <title> tag in your document; you should only have one
html.attribute-in-closing-tag: You have an attribute in your closing </__tag__> tag. Attributes always belong in the opening <__tag__> tag.
html.close-tag-for-void-element: You don’t need a closing </__tag__> tag. The <__tag__> tag closes itself.
html.html-in-css-block: It looks like you typed some HTML code inside a <style> tag. Remember that only CSS code can go inside a <style> tag.
html.invalid-attribute-name: __attribute__ isn’t allowed as an attribute name.
html.mismatched-close-tag: Your <__open__> tag needs a closing tag, but instead there’s a </__close__> tag where the </__open__> tag should be.
html.self-closing-non-void-element: A <__tag__> tag always needs a closing </__tag__> tag. Writing <__tag__/> is not allowed.
html.unclosed-tag: Your <__tag__> tag needs to be closed by an </__tag__> tag.
html.unexpected-close-tag: You have a closing </__tag__> tag that doesn’t match any opening <__tag__> tag.
html.unterminated-attribute-value: You forgot to put quotation marks after the value of the __attribute__ attribute in the <__tag__> tag.
html.unterminated-open-tag: You forgot to put a > at the end of your <__tag__> tag.
html.unterminated-close-tag: You forgot to put a > at the end of your </__tag__> tag.
html.unterminated-comment: You have a comment that never ends. End the comment with -->
html.unbound-attribute-value: The value __value__ isn’t attached to an attribute. Are you missing an = sign?
html.invalid-tag-name: <__tag__> isn’t a valid HTML tag. If you want to create a custom tag, make sure the name has a - in it, like <my-tag>

css.missing-curly: You have a starting { but no ending } to go with it.
css.property-missing-colon:
Put a colon (:) between the property and the value.
Try: color: red
css.block-expected:
Start a block using { after your selector.
Try: __error__ {
css.extra-tokens-after-value: Looks like you're missing a semicolon on the line before this one.
css.illegal-token-after-combinator: After a + or > in a selector, you need to specify the name of another element, class, or ID
css.invalid-token: This line doesn't look like valid CSS.
css.invalid-value: __error__ isn't a meaningful value for this property. Double-check what values you can use here.
css.require-value: Put a value for __error__ after the colon.
css.selector-expected: Use a comma to separate multiple tag names, classes, or IDs.
css.unknown-property: __error__ isn't a property that CSS understands. Double-check the name of the property that you want to use.

javascript.unexpected-string: JavaScript doesn’t expect a string where you wrote __value__. Remember that variable and function names aren’t surrounded in quotes.
javascript.unexpected-number: JavaScript doesn’t expect a number where you wrote __value__. Remember that variable and function names have to start with a letter.
javascript.invalid-left-hand-string: You wrote __value__ to the left of the = sign here, but that’s not a valid variable name. Remember that variable names aren’t surrounded by quotes.
javascript.invalid-left-hand-number: You wrote __value__ to the left of the = sign here, but that’s not a valid variable name. Remember that variable names have to start with a letter.
javascript.invalid-left-hand-boolean: You wrote __value__ to the left of the = sign here, but that’s not a valid variable name. Remember that true and false can’t be used as variable names.
javascript.invalid-left-hand-value: You wrote __value__ to the left of the = sign here, but that’s not a valid variable name.
javascript.unmatched: There is a __openingSymbol__ on this line that needs a closing __closingSymbol__
javascript.closing-match: There is a __openingSymbol__ on this line that needs a closing __closingSymbol__
javascript.expected-identifier: There's something missing from this line. Did you forget something?
javascript.undefined-variable: You can't use the variable __variable__ before declaring it.
javascript.unexpected-expression: It looks like there's something on this line that doesn't belong there
javascript.use-new-object: If you are making a new object, be sure to use it or store it in a variable
javascript.unnecessary-semicolon: You don't need a semicolon ; on this line
javascript.missing-semicolon: You need a semicolon ; at the end of this line
javascript.missing-parentheses:
There should be parentheses here.
Try: new __object__()
javascript.strict-comparison-operator: Use === to check if two things are equal
javascript.unused-variable: You don't use the variable __variable__ anywhere
javascript.unclosed-string: The string on this line needs to end with another quotation mark

strict-operators.custom-case: There should be a __goodOperator__ where you wrote __badOperator__

javascript.unexpected: You typed a "__character__" here, but that’s not allowed in JavaScript.
javascript.tokenize-error: This line doesn’t look like valid JavaScript.
javascript.bad-invocation: You’re trying to call something that isn’t a function.

javascriptRuntime.not-a-function_with-name: You tried to call __name__() as a function, but __name__ is not a function.
javascriptRuntime.not-a-function_with-name-type: You tried to call __name__() as a function, but __name__ is a __type__, not a function.
javascriptRuntime.not-a-function_with-name-value: You tried to call __name__() as a function, but __name__ is __value__, which is not a function.
javascriptRuntime.undefined-not-a-function_with-name: You tried to call __name__() as a function, but __name__ does not have a value.
javascriptRuntime.null-not-a-function_with-name: You tried to call __name__() as a function, but __name__ is null.
javascriptRuntime.access-property-of-undefined: You are trying to access a property of something that doesn't have a value.
javascriptRuntime.access-property-of-null: You are trying to access a property of a null value.
javascriptRuntime.access-property-of-undefined_with-name: You are trying to access a property of __name__, but __name__ doesn't have a value.
javascriptRuntime.access-property-of-null_with-name: You are trying to access a property of a __name__, but __name__ is null.
javascriptRuntime.read-property-of-undefined_with-property: You are trying to access the property __property__ on something that doesn't have a value.
javascriptRuntime.read-property-of-null_with-property: You are trying to access the property __property__ on a null value.
javascriptRuntime.set-property-of-undefined_with-property: You are trying to set the property __property__ on something that doesn't have a value.
javascriptRuntime.set-property-of-null_with-property: You are trying to set the property __property__ on a null value.
